p: Molecular characterization of NDV strains mostly considered the F-gene with particular emphasis given on the variable region (47–421 nt) because it codes for a number of functionally important structures such as signal peptide [amino acid (aa) 1–31], cleavage activation sequence (aa 112–116), portion of the fusion inducing hydrophobic region (aa 117–142) and it is characterized by both variable and conserved regions [ 19, 20]. Nucleotide sequence of the F-gene fragment (nt 47–420) is regarded as standard criterion for genotyping [ 21]. A molecular basis of pathogenicity has also been well established through sequence analysis of F-protein cleavage site. It was reported that the motiff 112R/K-R-Q-K/R-R 116 at the C-terminus of the F2 protein and F (phenylalanine) at the N-terminus of the F1 protein (residue 117) are major determinants of viral virulence [ 1, 2, 18, 22- 25]. A huge database of sequence data especially on F-gene sequences of NDVs isolated throughout the world has also been published and available for sequence comparison and phylogenetic studies [ 26].
